'''''Cantharellus friesii''''', the '''orange''' or '''velvet chanterelle''', is a [[fungus]] native to [[Asia]] and [[Europe]].<ref name=bmsname/>  The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] color varies from deep yellow to reddish orange and is 2–4 cm wide.  It occurs in [[beech]], [[fir]] and [[spruce]] forests.  ''C. friesii'' is considered a good [[edible mushroom]], but because of its rarity, it deserves [[protected species|protection]].  The [[botanical name|specific epithet]] ''friesii'' honors the mycologist [[Elias Magnus Fries]].
